com.github.bjarneh.utilz
Class handy

java.lang.Object
  com.github.bjarneh.utilz.handy

public class handy
extends Object

Collecting some handy functions that can be useful all over the place. 


 // Typical use:

 String[] lines = getLines(); // assume this does something
 String content = handy.join("\n", lines);

 ArrayList<String> list = new ArrayList<String>();
 handy.add( list, lines );

 String s = handy.dynReplace("<b>([^<]+)<\\/b>", "<b>b1</b> txt <b>b2</b>");
 s.equals("b1 txt b2"); // true
note: There is a lot of comments here since this is meant to be a library with some documentation, i.e. make sure you turn on your comment folding before you start reading this file.

dynReplace

public static String dynReplace(String regexpWithMatchGroup,
                                String str)
Replace every occurence of regexp (containing match-group) with match-group (sort of like $1 in some regexp implementations).

Parameters:
regexpWithMatchGroup - a pattern containing a match-group
str - the string we want to replace stuff in
Returns:
a string were pattern is replaced with match-group

uriQuery

public static HashMap<String,String> uriQuery(URI uri,
                                              String enc)
                                       throws UnsupportedEncodingException
Split URI query into a map. NOTE: this version overwrites entries with the same name, i.e. each key has to be unique for this to work.

Parameters:
uri - an URI with a query
enc - name of charset for decoding query
Returns:
a map with key value pair from query or null on empty query
Throws:
UnsupportedEncodingException

Returns:
a map with key value pair from query or null for empty query
